COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. 

 A negative COVID-19 test issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure is required for entry. Test results must be a complete report and presented on the official letterhead of the laboratory where the test was conducted.
column3:
Quarantine requirement at government designated site.


All incoming international travelers are required to quarantine at a government-supervised facility for 21 days.

Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Tonga: A State of Emergency was declared on 20 March 2020 by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga, this has been renewed until 8pm on 14 March 2022. Tongan borders are closed to entry to all foreign nationals, except if authorisation is granted by the relevant Tongan government authorities.
No international cruise ships and yachts will be granted entry into Tonga until further notice.
All international cruise ships and yachts will not be granted entry into Tonga until further notice.
Some countries in the region have also introduced travel restrictions to and from the Pacific islands. You should check specifics for any countries that might be involved in your travel when planning a trip to Tonga.
*Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: Tonga will only accept the letter version of proof of COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record and proof of COVID-19 vaccination issued in the Crown Dependencies. They will not accept digital proof. Your final vaccine dose must have been administered prior to travel. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*Visas: If you hold a short-term visa for Tonga which is close to expiry, you should report to the Immigration Office to have your visa extended. Further information can be found at the Ministry of Revenue & Customs website.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Tonga: Tonga is currently subject to two States of Emergency and National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions.
A State of Emergency for Public Health was declared by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga on 20 March 2020. This has been renewed until 8pm on 14 March 2022. The Declaration of a Public Health Emergency (COVID-19) Regulations 2020 and the Declaration of an Emergency Notifiable Condition has also been extended to 14 March 2022.
A State of Emergency following the Hunga-Tonga Hunga-Haâ€™apai volcanic eruption was renewed by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga on 13 February 2022 until 8am on 13 March 2022. This includes a number Tongan islands and locations on Tongatapu; members of the public are prohibited from entering during this period.
National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions were announced by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga on 1 February 2022 and introduced additional protective measures. Lockdown restrictions will ease on 21 February for retail shops and takeaway food services between the hours of 6am to 6pm However, other lockdown restrictions remain in place from 6pm to 6am.
For information on both States of Emergency and the National Lockdown Restrictions, especially while telecommunications remain challenging, you should check local media reports.
*Public places and services: During National Lockdown Restrictions, public places including places of worship, bars and nightclubs will remain closed.
